Ph.D. student in the Electrical Engineering and Computer Science (EECS) program at MIT and a CSAIL affiliate, working under the supervision of Prof. Justin Solomon. Previously, I completed my Master's in Computer Science at the University of Toronto and spent over a year working as a machine learning scientist at Layer 6.
My research focuses on deep generative models, understanding the geometric behavior of data through the lens of these models, and using these insights to improve model performance. Additionally, I have experience in causal inference, in-context learning, and tabular predictive modeling.
Outside of research, I enjoy gaming, hiking, and a good round of competitive programming with friends.
